Fending off the suggestion that the pressure it was feeling from the rise of Facebook had forced the change, Mr Eric Schmidt added: This is definitely not because of any one competitor. It's about the rate at which we operate. Debate about whether Google has lost its edge has been rife in Silicon Valley tech circles in recent months. Donald Rumsfeld of Defense after Abu Ghraib- twice. President Bush refused to accept both times, keeping Donald Rumsfeld on at the Pentagon, where he turned into a lightning rod for criticism of the invasion and occupation of Iraq. In an exclusive interview with ABC's Diane Sawyer , Donald Rumsfeld also said the enhanced interrogation techniques he approved for use on the so-called`` 20th hijacker - including forced stress positions and removal of`` comfort items''- produced invaluable intelligence. But his biggest regret was staying in office during what he calls a period of`` damaging distraction,''
